subject: Public Speaking
title: Framing: The Invisible Persuader
description: One-minute skill: Framing: The Invisible Persuader.

hook.text: A surgery with 90% survival rate sounds safe. One with 10% death rate sounds dangerous. Same fact, different frame.

buildup.text: Framing is how you present information. Tversky and Kahneman proved frames change decisions even when facts match.

discovery.text: In politics, framing is everything. 'Death tax' vs 'estate tax.' 'Pro-life' vs 'anti-choice.' The frame IS the argument.

twist.text: Once a frame is set, it's extremely hard to replace. The first framing of an issue usually wins the public debate.

climax.text: The most powerful persuasion doesn't change what people think about. It changes how they think about it.

punchline.text: Control the frame. Control the conversation.

quiz.question: What did Tversky and Kahneman prove about framing?
options: Frames change decisions even when the underlying facts are identical
